title: Andrea Belotti: Torino striker insists he will STAY at Italian side in bitter blow for Arsenal and Chelsea
text:
EFL YOU BETTER BEL-IEVE IT Andrea Belotti: Torino striker insists he will STAY at Italian side in bitter blow for Arsenal and Chelsea 
In January it was believed the Gunners launched a £55million bid for the 23-year-old frontman that was rejected out of hand By John Hutchinson Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL and Chelsea have been dealt a bitter blow after striker target Andrea Belotti signalled his intention to stay at Torino. 
The two Premier League clubs are believed to be chasing the 23-year-old, who has scored 24 goals in all competitions this season. EPA Andrea Belotti has said he will stay at Torino next season – dealing a bitter blow to Arsenal and Chelsea 
But it seems the Italian is set to stay at Torino – at least for now.

Speaking to Tuttosport about his future, Belotti said: “Of course I am staying. 
“I want to remain at Torino. In fact, I will stay at Torino next season. 
“Let the Granata fans know! In January, it is believed Arsenal were rebuffed after bidding £55million for the frontman. 
Real Madrid and Barcelona are tracking Belotti, who won the Serie B title with Palermo in 2014 before proving he could handle the Italian top flight.
